language-r-0.1: A package for parsing and compiling R/Splus code.ContentsIndex
Language.R.Lexer
Portabilityportable
Stabilityexperimental
MaintainerDavid Rosenberg <rosenbergdm@uchicago.edu>
Description

Created : 052810

Description : This module contains the functions used for lexing an list of strings (representing either source code lines or interactive input) into a stack of tokens.

Synopsis
rTokens :: ParsecT String LexState Identity [Token]
rToken :: ParsecT String LexState Identity Token
rComment :: ParsecT String LexState Identity Tok
rString :: ParsecT String LexState Identity Tok
rSymbol :: ParsecT String LexState Identity Tok
rNumber :: ParsecT String LexState Identity Tok
rIdent :: ParsecT String LexState Identity Tok
Documentation
rTokens :: ParsecT String LexState Identity [Token]
The top token lexer function. TODO: The sepBy clause is not correct.
rToken :: ParsecT String LexState Identity Token
Lex a single token from the input stream and add it to the LexState stack.
rComment :: ParsecT String LexState Identity Tok
Comments begin with an (unquoted) pound sign and continue until the end of the line.
rString :: ParsecT String LexState Identity Tok
A string can be either single-quoted or double quoted and (within the string) backslashes serve as escapes. TODO: No escape function provided. TODO: Single-quoting not implemented.
rSymbol :: ParsecT String LexState Identity Tok
A symbol is any non-space, non-alphanumeric character.
rNumber :: ParsecT String LexState Identity Tok
A number is lexed as a continuous list of digits.
rIdent :: ParsecT String LexState Identity Tok
Atoms can only begin with a letter or a period. After the first character, any alphanumeric character or one of -, _, and . are permitted.
